title: 1994 Northridge earthquake
summary:
The 1994 Northridge earthquake was a moment magnitude 6.7 (Mw),[8] blind thrust earthquake that occurred on January 17, 1994, at 4:30:55 a.m. PST in the San Fernando Valley region of the City of Los Angeles. 
The quake had a duration of approximately 10–20 seconds, and its peak ground acceleration of 1.82 g[9][10] was the highest ever instrumentally recorded in an urban area in North America.[11]  Shaking was felt as far away as San Diego, Turlock, Las Vegas, Richfield, and Ensenada.[12] The peak ground velocity at the Rinaldi Receiving Station was 183 cm/s (4.1 mph; 6.6 km/h),[7] the fastest ever recorded.
